instructions.guideline: Decompose product vision into independently valuable epics
Each epic should deliver standalone user value
Epics should be sized for 2-3 month implementation
Include clear acceptance criteria at epic level
Define dependencies between epics at business level only
STRATEGIC FOCUS: Epics describe WHAT and WHY, not HOW. No technical implementation details.

template.structure:
# Epic: [Epic Title]
## Metadata - **Epic ID:** EPIC-[XXX] - **Status:** [Draft/In Review/Approved/Planned/In Progress/Completed] - **Priority:** [Critical/High/Medium/Low] - **Parent Product Vision:** VIS-[XXX] - **Parent Initiative:** INIT-[XXX] (if part of initiative) - **Owner:** [Name] - **Target Release:** [Q1 2025] - **Informed By Business Research:** {SDLC_DOCUMENTS_URL}/business-research
## Epic Statement As [user persona], I need [capability] so that [business value].
## Parent Artifact Context
**Parent Product Vision:** [VIS-XXX: Vision Title] - **Link:** {SDLC_DOCUMENTS_URL}/product-vision/{id} (example: {SDLC_DOCUMENTS_URL}/product-vision/001) - **Vision Capability:** [Which key capability from vision this epic implements]
**Parent Initiative:** [INIT-XXX: Initiative Title] (if applicable) - **Link:** {SDLC_DOCUMENTS_URL}/initiative/{id} (example: {SDLC_DOCUMENTS_URL}/initiative/042) - **Initiative Contribution:** [How this epic contributes to initiative OKRs]
## Business Value [Clear articulation of why this epic matters]
### User Impact [How users benefit from this epic]
### Business Impact [Quantified business outcomes] - [Metric 1]: [Expected improvement] - [Metric 2]: [Expected improvement]
## Problem Being Solved [Specific problem this epic addresses from product vision]
## Business Research References
**Primary Research Document:** {SDLC_DOCUMENTS_URL}/business-research
**Market Insights Applied:** - **Gap Analysis (§3.1):** [Specific gap this epic addresses] - **Capability Recommendation (§4.1):** [Which recommended capability this implements] - **User Persona (§Appendix A):** [Target persona from research]
**Competitive Context:** [Reference competitive analysis from business research that justifies this epic's approach]
## Scope
### In Scope - [Capability 1] - [Capability 2] - [Capability 3]
### Out of Scope - [What is explicitly not included] - [Deferred to future epics]
## User Stories (High-Level) [List of major user stories that comprise this epic - not detailed yet]
1. **Story 1:** As [role], I want [feature] so that [benefit] 2. **Story 2:** As [role], I want [feature] so that [benefit] 3. **Story 3:** As [role], I want [feature] so that [benefit]
## Acceptance Criteria (Epic Level)
### Criterion 1 **Given** [context] **When** [user action] **Then** [system response]
### Criterion 2 **Given** [context] **When** [user action] **Then** [system response]
## Success Metrics
| Metric | Target | Measurement Method | |--------|--------|-------------------| | [Metric 1] | [Goal] | [How measured] | | [Metric 2] | [Goal] | [How measured] |
## Dependencies & Risks (Business Level)
### Epic Dependencies - **Depends On:** [EPIC-XXX: Must complete first] - **Blocks:** [EPIC-YYY: This epic must complete first]
### Business Risks & Mitigations
| Risk | Likelihood | Impact | Mitigation Strategy | |------|------------|--------|-------------------| | [Business/Market Risk 1] | High/Med/Low | High/Med/Low | [Strategy] | | [Adoption/User Risk 2] | High/Med/Low | High/Med/Low | [Strategy] |
**Note:** Technical dependencies, architecture decisions, and implementation risks are deferred to PRD phase (transition phase where technical research is introduced).
## Effort Estimation - **Complexity:** [Low/Medium/High] - **Estimated Story Points:** [Range: e.g., 80-120] - **Estimated Duration:** [e.g., 2-3 months] - **Team Size:** [e.g., 2 frontend, 2 backend, 1 QA]
## Milestones - **Milestone 1** (Week 4): [Deliverable] - **Milestone 2** (Week 8): [Deliverable] - **Milestone 3** (Week 12): [Deliverable]
## Definition of Done (Epic Level) - [ ] All user stories completed and accepted - [ ] Acceptance criteria met and validated - [ ] Code reviewed and merged - [ ] Tests passing (unit, integration, e2e) - [ ] Documentation updated - [ ] Performance benchmarks met - [ ] Security review completed - [ ] Deployed to production - [ ] Success metrics baseline captured
## Open Questions
**IMPORTANT: Include ONLY business-level questions. Technical questions and product/technical trade-offs belong in PRD phase.**
**Epic Open Questions focus on:** - Market priorities and user segments - Business model and pricing - Regulatory/compliance requirements - Strategic timing and resource allocation
**EXCLUDE from Epic (defer to PRD phase):** - Technical questions (architecture, implementation, technology choices) - Product/technical trade-offs (requiring PM + Tech Lead collaboration)
---
✅ **Examples of ACCEPTABLE questions (business-only):** - "Should we prioritize enterprise or SMB customers in the initial release?" - "Are there data privacy regulations specific to our target markets?" - "What is the acceptable customer acquisition cost for this feature?" - "Should we target mobile or desktop users first?"
❌ **Examples of UNACCEPTABLE questions - Technical (defer to PRD/Tech Spec/ADR):** - "Should we use OAuth2 or SAML for authentication?" - "What database should we use for storage?" - "Should the API be REST or GraphQL?" - "Which cloud provider should host this?"
❌ **Examples of UNACCEPTABLE questions - Product/Technical Trade-offs (defer to PRD - PM + Tech Lead):** - "Should we prioritize offline-first capability or real-time sync in V1?" - "What authentication approach balances user experience with security requirements?" - "Should we build or integrate with third-party service for notifications?"
---
**If no business questions exist, state:** "No open business questions at this time. Technical decisions and product/technical trade-offs will be addressed in PRD phase."
---
- [Business Question 1] - [Business Question 2]
## Related Documents - **Parent Product Vision:** {SDLC_DOCUMENTS_URL}/product-vision/{id} - **Parent Initiative:** {SDLC_DOCUMENTS_URL}/initiative/{id} (if applicable) - **Business Research:** {SDLC_DOCUMENTS_URL}/business-research (with specific sections referenced) - **Related ADRs:** {SDLC_DOCUMENTS_URL}/adr/{id} - **Technical Specs:** {SDLC_DOCUMENTS_URL}/tech-spec/{id} - **User Research:** [Links]

examples.example:
# Epic: User Authentication System
As a CLI tool user, I need secure authentication so that my data remains private and only I can access my account.
Business Value: - User Impact: Users can trust the tool with sensitive data - Business Impact: Reduces support tickets by 40% (no password reset requests initially)
High-Level Stories: 1. As a new user, I want to create an account so that I can use the tool 2. As a returning user, I want to log in securely so that I can access my data 3. As a security-conscious user, I want 2FA so that my account is extra secure
